result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donquel Ormone Perry

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donquel Ormone Perry in court.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Donquel Ormone Perry.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Review Hearing scheduled
Review hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.  rmm

Defendant Donquel Ormone Perry appeared by video.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Donquel Ormone Perry.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Atty. Wait requests a DPA hearing date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Donquel Ormone Perry in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held via zoom. Parties are discussing a possible DPA resolution, Attorney Wait is requesting an additional status date. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Donquel O Perry in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Status conference held. Defense has received an offer and is requesting additional time to discuss with defendant. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Donquel Ormone Perry in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  
Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Atty. Wait has received discovery but not an offer and requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Appointing Counsel at County Expense, signed and filed.  rmm

Defendant Donquel Ormone Perry in court.  
Brandon Schwebler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom.  Matter set for pretrial conference.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Patrick Wait as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Wait accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 7/01/22 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
 No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Donquel Ormone Perry in court.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge  Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 1.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/12/22 @ 1p
